definition: to blame/to reprove/to reprimand/to expel/to oust/to reconnoiter/(of territory) to expand/saline marsh

sentences.english: He routinely reprimanded employees at the top of his lungs.
sentences.chinese: 他如往常一樣聲嘶力竭地訓斥着手下的員工。

sentences.english: The teacher harangued us all about our untidy work.
sentences.chinese: 老師對於凌亂的作業對我們全部喋喋不休地訓斥。

sentences.english: "I can see right through you, " Bunny scolded.
sentences.chinese: “我已看透了你的壞心腸”邦尼訓斥着說。

sentences.english: One day, as she was scolding me, I suddenly threw a question at her.
sentences.chinese: 一天，她訓斥我時，我冷不防向她提了個問題。

sentences.english: She often bites off his nose on his bad English.
sentences.chinese: 因爲他糟糕的英語，她經常聲色俱厲地訓斥他。

sentences.english: The manager bawled Roy out for being late again.
sentences.chinese: 羅伊又遲到了，經理把他大聲訓斥一頓。

sentences.english: On hearing the news, the boss gave a dressing down to all those clerks that were involved in the business.
sentences.chinese: 老闆聽到阿誰動靜後峻厲訓斥了介入此事的人員。

sentences.english: Don't keep getting onto the boy in this way, it will not do any good.
sentences.chinese: 別老是這樣訓斥孩子，這不會有什麼好處。

sentences.english: Don't keep jawing your little brother any more for his mistake.
sentences.chinese: 別再爲你弟弟的過錯訓斥他了。

sentences.english: Peter was skinned for playing truant.
Every scolding that girl gets just seems to glance off her.
sentences.chinese: 每次訓斥對這女孩似乎不起任何作用。

sentences.english: I chewed him out but good - it won't happen again.
sentences.chinese: 我把他狠狠地訓斥了一番，這樣的事不會再發生了。

sentences.english: When the teacher had got through with her,she felt very ashamed.
sentences.chinese: 老師訓斥她後，她感到十分羞愧。

sentences.english: She gave me such a tongue-lashing that I never touched any cigarette all my life.
sentences.chinese: 她狠狠的訓斥了我一頓，使我這輩子再沒碰過一根菸。

sentences.english: He let me off with a reprimand.
sentences.chinese: 他把我訓斥了一頓就讓我過了。

definition: to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
to fly into a rage out of humiliation/to be ashamed into anger (idiom)
to rain curses (on sb)/to let sb have it/to bawl sb out
to be furious/to fly into a terrible rage
to enumerate sb's shortcomings/to criticize/to scold/to talk on and on
frigid irony and scorching satire (idiom); to mock and ridicule
to condemn in speech and in writing (idiom)/to denounce by word and pen
